CHAT.comment: the room is small , about ten feet square , on one side of the room is a bookcase , on the wall at right angles to the bookcase wall is a desk , there are two easy chairs in the room. at the start of the recording June and her mother are sitting in the center of the floor playing with a toy train.

u.a: silence during which mother starts stacking blocks , June picks up a block .
June places the block on top of the others .
June places another block on the pile .
this is an idiosyncratic label which means something like , read to me , or talk to me about this .
at this point mother thinks that puttaputta is restricted to the rhyme Peter Piper but it later becomes apparent that it has the wider meaning set out in the previous comment .
no response , mother stacks the blocks in a tower
mother rocks the truck gently until the tower collapses , silence during which mother restacks the blocks , the blocks fall again .
mother restacks the blocks , June picks up a block
mother places another block on the tower
June reaches out with the block .
June knocks down the tower as she tries to place the block .
mother opens the shapesorter and sees a stacking block inside it .
mother puts the block on the tray with the others and then begins to rake around inside the shapesorter .
mother lifts down the jigsaw puzzle .
she lifts out the blocks and puts them with the stacking blocks on the tray , then she tips out the shapes from the shapesorter onto the floor in front of June .
June picks up the cubic shape , mother rotates the shapesorter looking for the correct hole .
mother points to the correct hole , June reaches out and with mother's help drops the shape through the hole .
mother rotates the shapesorter searching for the correct hole .
mother helps June to pop the shape through the hole .
June picks a third shape up and tries to put it through the same hole .
mother is looking at the other side of the shapesorter .
mother rotates the shapesorter so that June can see the hole .
June tries and with mother's help the shape falls .
June picks up another shape and tries to put it through a hole .
the shape falls , June tries again with another shape .
mother pokes finger through correct hole .
June drops the shape through the hole .
June puts her cookie through the hole .
June peers through the hole and puts her finger through it .
silence during which June picks out the shapes one by one .
mother places some shapes in front of June .
June picks up a shape and tries to put through a hole .
mother pokes her finger through the hole .
June throws the shape onto the floor .
mother places the shape in the hole and June pushes it through
<aft> mother puts her finger through the hole . <3w-4w> mother looks for the correct hole
June gives the shape to her mother who puts it in the hole .
silence during which June picks up another shape and tries it in a hole June pushes the shape through the hole .
silence , mother is still pointing at the hole .
silence . mother drops the shape on the floor .
mother rotates the shapesorter and gets a new shape . no response .
she rotates the shapesorter and then places the shape in a hole .
June ignores her mother and picks up a different shape .
no response , mother drops the shape , silence during which mother picks up another shape and places it in a hole
no response , mother drops the shape through the hole and then puts the shapesorter aside , mother begins to play with the stacking blocks .
mother builds two towers with the blocks .
silence during which June looks at the towers and her mother hands her a block . June rejects the offered block by turning her head away .

long silence during which mother builds two more stacks and looks at June . June looks at the stacks , looks at mother and then the stacks again . then she reaches out for a block and causes the collapse of the towers . June sneezes and then hands the block she picked up to her mother .
June hands another block to mother .
mother holds a shape in a hole in the shapesorter and June pushes it through .
mother points to another shape and another hole .
mother puts down the shape , silence during which mother and June play with stacking blocks .
mother collapses the tower , long silence during which June plays with the blocks .
silence during which June plays with the trolley string and mother gets a set of nesting dolls from the bookcase , June puts out her hand .
June pulls the top off the first doll .
and then replaces it and puts the top back on it . June gets the second doll out and splits it , takes out the third doll
silence during which June hands the second doll to mother .
mother holds the base and June pulls off the top .
long silence during which June puts the top back on the second doll , puts the second doll inside the first doll , replaces the top and then dismantles it all again .
June picks up the power cable to the tape recorder .
no response , mother picks up the smallest doll .
June picks up the nested set and splits it open again .
June hands the top of the largest doll to mother .
June hands the rest of the doll to her mother .
mother holds out the nesting dolls for June . June pulls the top of the largest doll off .
June puts the top back on again .
mother thinks that puttaputta means Peter Piper .
reading , June picks up the book and looks at it
June takes the book and hands it back to mother .
June picks up the book and hands it to her mother .
June splits the nesting doll which she has been holding while her mother was reading and hands the top to mother .
then they both fit the doll back together again .
June repeats the above action . mother puts the doll on the floor . silence during which June picks up the book and hands it to her mother .
June takes the book , looks at it and the hands it back to her mother .
June takes the book again , looks at it again and then hands it back again .
mother hands the book to June .
June hands the book back again .
silence during which June looks at the book and then hands it to her mother .
silence during which mother puts the book on June's knee . June looks at the book for a while and eventually hands it back to her mother .
long silence during which mother gets Mr Potatohead and June reaches out for it and pulls it to her . June pulls off a piece and hands it to her mother .
June pulls off a second piece and hands it to her mother .
June takes the pieces back from her mother and tries unsuccessfully to replace them and then dumps them on the floor .
June hands a piece to her mother .
no response , June carries on playing with Mr Potatohead
mother hands the piece to June .
mother hands an ear to June .
June puts the ear on correctly .
June tries unsuccessfully to put the nose on and then tosses it away but continues to play with Mr Potatohead .
no response , silence during which mother is still looking around
silence during which June takes the mouth . she pulls the pieces out of Mr Potatohead again . mother picks up the mouth again and hands it to June .
silence during which June takes all the parts out of Mr Potatohead . then she creeps into the corner , gets a book and hands it to her mother .
throughout this whole utterance June has paid no attention to her mother she has been picking things out of the toybox , mother turns to June and shows her the picture in the book .
June then looks at a different book . her mother peers over the top of it .
mother points to the picture in the child's book .
June hands the book to her mother .
silence during which June looks at the camera and then around the room . then she pulls another book out of the toybox . mother looks at the new book and points to a picture in it .
no response , silence during which June returns to the tom and jerry book and looks through the pages and then hands it to her mother .
mother turns the book towards June and points to the picture .
June takes the book , turns the page and then hands it back to her mother .
mother turns to June and stops reading .
<38w> June is listening and patting the side of the toybox .
silence during which June gets another book and gives it to her mother . while June is searching for the book her mother is fixing Mr Potatohead .
June picks up the Tom and Jerry book and hands it to her mother .
June begins to turn the pages .
June sits up and begins pointing to various parts of the page .
June points to the correct cat .
June takes the book and after turning several pages she hands it back to her mother .
silence , June reaches for another book
she hands the book to her mother .
mother points to each monkey as she counts them , June points to the page .
no response , after a pause June begins to point to the monkeys again .
mother begins to count but June takes the book and begins turning the pages , mother interrupts the page turning .
silence during which June gets another book out of the toybox and hands it to her mother .
June takes the book from her mother .

June looks in the toybox again . she finds a block which she tosses on the floor by her mother . mother hands it back and June tosses it on the floor again . mother hands it back again and June tosses it on the floor again . mother hands it back to her again and June dumps it on the floor again . then she drops the last book into the toybox puts two more books into the toybox , stops , picks out the last book , opens it and hands it to her mother .
mother points to a picture in the book
June picks up the Tom and Jerry book again and hands it to her mother .
